labels.text: This film traces the early activities of the Stars Group, active in Beijing in the 1970s. The video documents the opening and subsequent closure of the group’s first unapproved exhibition outside the National Art Museum in Beijing, their protest for artistic freedom, and the reopening of the exhibition at Beihai Park. This footage, which has never been exhibited, offers a rare view into the early days of the underground collective in 1979. It is the only known video documentation of these pivotal events.

This film traces the early activities of the Stars Group of artists, who worked in Beijing in the 1970s. It documents the opening and subsequent closure of the group’s first unapproved exhibition outside the National Art Museum in Beijing, their protest for artistic freedom, and the reopening of the exhibition at Beihai Park. This footage, which has never been exhibited, offers a rare view of the early days of the underground collective in 1979. It is the only known video documentation of these events, which were pivotal in the history of Chinese contemporary art.
片中記錄了1970年代活躍於北京的「星星畫會」成立初期的片段：在中國美術館旁舉行首場不受官方批准的畫展，其後展覽被迫中止，成員繼而上街遊行，表達對藝術自由的訴求，展覽最終在北海公園再度舉行。這些30多年以來首次在公眾眼前出現的鏡頭，展示了這個地下前衛藝術團體於1979年成立之初的稀有片段，亦是其唯一的錄像檔案。
片中記錄了七十年代活躍於北京的「星星畫會」成立初期的片段：在中國美術館旁舉行首場不獲官方批准的畫展，其後展覽被迫中止，成員繼而上街遊行，表達對藝術自由的訴求，展覽最終在北海公園再度舉行。這些三十多年以來首次在公眾眼前出現的鏡頭，展示了這個地下前衛藝術團體於1979年成立之初的稀有片段，亦是其唯一的錄像檔案。

images.AltText: Still from a monochrome film. Men in work uniforms march down a street, some holding protest signs. A prominent banner reads: "to protect the constitution".
images.AltTextTC: 黑白錄像截圖中，一群身穿工作制服的男人在街上遊行，部分人手持示威標語，其中一張橫額清楚顯示「維護憲法遊行」。
